title: Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil tops weekend box office with $36 million, some way below expectations
text:
Disney's Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil topped the weekend box office chart with $36 million in its first weekend... but that was $9 million under expectations.

Again starring Angelina Jolie as Malificent, it raised only half of the original, which made $64.9 million in its first outing in 2014, according to Box Office Mojo.

Not even Michelle Pfeiffer as evil Queen Ingrith could coax audiences into the multiplex. But those who did see it gave it a healthy A rating on Cinemascore.

Coming in first: Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil, starring Angelina Jolie, topped the weekend box office chart with $36 million, some $9 million under expectations

It did better around the world picking up another $117 million for a $153 million global debut.

Actor Joaquin Phoenix's Joker raked in $29.2 million in its third weekend for a total of $247.2 million in North America so far.

Batman's scary villain also made $490 million elsewhere for a global total of $737.5 million.

Zombieland: Double Tap opened on the high end of industry expectations, bringing in an estimated $26.7 million for the three-day weekend.

Sliding into second: Joaquin Phoenix's Joker raked in $29.2 million in its third weekend for a total of $247.2 million in North America so far

Playing well: Zombieland: Double Tap opened on the high end of industry expectations, bringing in an estimated $26.7 million for the three-day weekend, for third place

It also scared up $5.3 million in other markets for a global take of just over $32 million.

The comedy-horror-action movie stars Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg and Emma Stone facing off against zombies, fellow survivors and family strife.

Family animated comedy The Addams Family came in fourth with just over $16 million in its second weekend on release, pushing its domestic haul to $56.8 million.

The remake of the hit 1960s TV show and 1991 movie, stars the voice talents of Oscar Isaac as Gomez, Charlize Theron as Morticia, Chloe Grace Moretz as Wednesday and Finn Wolfhard as Pugsley.

Family fun: Animated comedy The Addams Family came in fourth with just over $16 million in its second weekend on release, pushing its domestic haul to $56.8 million

Other luminaries offering their voices are Nick Kroll, Snoop Dogg, Bette Midler, Allison Janey, and Martin Short.

Will Smith's sci-fi adventure Gemini Man came in fifth in its second weekend with an estimated $8.5 million for a domestic cume of $36.5 million.

Internationally, the film added an estimated $33.4 million this weekend bringing its global tally to $118.7 million.
description: The Disney follow up, starring Angelina as Maleficent and Michelle Pfeiffer as evil Queen Ingrith, came in some $9 million under industry expectations, according to Box Office Mojo.
